Issues.Title: XAML Designer issue with WindowStyle="None"
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.101
* Windows version: 1909
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No

 **Problem description:**
 XAML Preview is not working when I set the `WindowStyle` property to `None`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "XAML Designer issue with WindowStyle="None"" (#2590)

Issues.Title: Use theme to create DocumentGridPage borders
Issues.Body:
Does what the title says. The border/shadow can now be customized by creating a style with the key `{ComponentResourceKey TypeInTargetAssembly={x:Type FrameworkElement}, ResourceId=DocumentGridPageContainerWithBorder}` at whatever scope you desire. The default value for this style is a copy of the current, manually constructed border. [Here is a zipped demo project](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/4201467/DocumentViewerTest.zip); note that you'll have to change the WpfRepoRoot variable in `DocumentViewerTest.csproj` before building.

I also took the opportunity to rewrite `ThemeGenerator.nativeproj`. It is now stripped of all MS-internal-isms and can be run with MSBuild directly to regenerate the XAML files in the theme projects.

Fixes #1518.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Use theme to create DocumentGridPage borders" (#2574)

Issues.Title: WpfGfx doesn't compile
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.200-preview-014883
* Windows version: 18362.592
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: N/A, build issue
 
 **Problem description:**

When I try to compile WpfGfx, I get a number of C++ static_cast errors in `vector3_xm.hpp`, `quaternion_xm.hpp`, and `matrix_xm.hpp`. This breaks the build.
 
 **Actual behavior:**

Large number of repeated errors (see attached binlog).
 
 **Expected behavior:**

It should build.
 
 **Minimal repro:**

I am on commit eb6fca39dee92f8cb74ed08386729dea48d4709a. A zipped binlog is here: [Build.binlog.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/4194636/Build.binlog.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WpfGfx doesn't compile" (#2561)

Issues.Title: TAB navigation allows you to navigate to hidden Hyperlinks
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1
* Windows version: Windows 10 64bit
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes

 **Problem description:**

Even if the Visibility of the TextBox is set to Collapsed, you can still navigate to internal hyperlinks via TAB navigation.

This can cause unintended hyperlink processing.
 
 **Minimal repro:**

```
<TextBlock Visibility="Collapsed">
    <Hyperlink Click="Hyperlink_Click">LINK</Hyperlink>
</TextBlock>
```

```
private void Hyperlink_Click(object sender, RoutedEventArgs e)
{
    MessageBox.Show("Clicked");
}
```

1. Press TAB key -> Focus moves to invisible Hyperlink.
2. Press Enter key -> Hyperlink event is executed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TAB navigation allows you to navigate to hidden Hyperlinks" (#2569)

Issues.Title: The x:Key has no intellisense in XAML.
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.1
* Windows version: 1909 
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? If yes, please file the issue via the instructions [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/visualstudio/ide/how-to-report-a-problem-with-visual-studio?view=vs-2019).
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:**
 I have a resource key defined as below:
```csharp
namespace Wpf1
{
	public abstract class ResourceExtension : TypeExtension
	{
		public ResourceExtension()
		{
			this.Type = this.GetType();
		}
		public override object ProvideValue(IServiceProvider serviceProvider)
		{
			return this.Type;
		}
	}
	public class NormalBackground : ResourceExtension
	{
	}
}
```

And I use it in XAML as below:
```xaml
<Window
    x:Class="Wpf1.MainWindow"
    xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation"
    xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml"
    xmlns:d="http://schemas.microsoft.com/expression/blend/2008"
    xmlns:mc="http://schemas.openxmlformats.org/markup-compatibility/2006"
    xmlns:local="clr-namespace:Wpf1"
    mc:Ignorable="d"
    Title="MainWindow"
    Height="450"
    Width="800">
    <Window.Resources>
        <SolidColorBrush
            x:Key="{local:NormalBackground}"
            Color="Green" />
    </Window.Resources>
    <Grid>
        <Border
            Background="{StaticResource {local:NormalBackground}}" />
    </Grid>
</Window>
```

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
 When I type the **x:Key="{local:NormalBackground}"**, it has no intellisense, however when I type the **Background="{StaticResource {local:NormalBackground}}"**, the intellisense works fine.

 **Expected behavior:**
 The x:Key also has intellisense.

 **Minimal repro:**
[Wpf1.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/4196339/Wpf1.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The x:Key has no intellisense in XAML." (#2564)
